title: [Large-Scale] Practical Typology and Factor Analysis of Remote Education Teachers' Perceptions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of distance education concepts and foundational statistical analysis skills
context.additional_context: Process for pre-service teachers to learn methods of analyzing and categorizing teacher perceptions on core issues in remote education

learning_goals: Explain five core issues (higher-order constructs) of distance education.
Classify teacher perception data into five categories using factor analysis.
Apply cluster analysis to categorize teacher types into four groups: skeptics, optimists, cautious expectants, and unique cases.
Propose directions for improving distance education policies based on analysis results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
